column4: Anyone know a good channel that could help me save as much as possible from a damaged hard drive(possibly making it work again). It reports an error and an OS that tries to boot from it doesn't get far before it crashes and the computer reboots. Ubuntu diagnostics tell me I should try repairing it, neither filesystem on it mounts
how is the drive hooked up?
like I said, hook the drive up as a secondary drive
I didn't see you said that, but okay, thanks. Just one problem though: how do I do that?
told me to hook my hdd as a secondary drive, and I have no idea what that means
err, nope. I'm booting from an usb stick
youve got a ntfs partition on there
what type of data do you want to retrieve?
dunno. I can't remember what was on that disk
cant you just hook it up to the windows machine?
yeah, I can. It's just that, it's this machine I'd have to boot
well then, do what I said and take a look at TestDisk
